How to Install goldendict on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • goldendict

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install goldendict on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing goldendict on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall goldendict in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install goldendict, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install goldendict Using apt

To install goldendict in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install goldendict using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install goldendict

The installation of goldendict might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install goldendict Using apt-get

To install goldendict using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install goldendict.

sudo apt-get -y install goldendict

Install goldendict Using Synaptic

To install goldendict using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install goldendict on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for goldendict. This will display the goldendict package in the package window, now to install goldendict, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the goldendict package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of goldendict.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install goldendict Using aptitude

To install goldendict on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of goldendict.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install goldendict using the command aptitude install goldendict.

sudo aptitude -y install goldendict

How to Upgrade goldendict on debian

If you want to upgrade the goldendict package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade goldendict using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade goldendict to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade goldendict.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade goldendict sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade goldendict

Upgrade goldendict using Aptitude

To upgrade goldendict using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade goldendict.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade goldendict

Upgrade goldendict using Synaptic

To upgrade goldendict using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for goldendict, now right-click goldendict, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade goldendict just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall goldendict on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall goldendict from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just goldendict, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove goldendict

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of goldendict

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of goldendict you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge goldendict

Remove goldendict using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall goldendict using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for goldendict, right-click the goldendict package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall goldendict click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install goldendict on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade goldendict using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of goldendict then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
